Articles.Content:
So I am working my way through career mode and I have encountered a problem with the Astronaut complex... I can no longer hire kerbals. I have it upgraded to tier 3 but when I click the green check to hire a kerbal nothing happens. It also says that the next kerbal will cost 0 kerbal cash. I can still get new kerbals through missions but that is very tedious. Can anyone point me in the right direction?

P.S. I have no idea what I am doing when it comes to editing save files or configs or anything of the sort.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-18T02:13:45Z" title="07/18/2015 02:13  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 18, 2015</time> by Claw**

I don't recall hearing of this problem lately. It would be helpful if you could include a little more info, such as a save file and log file.

You can check here to see where to find those files: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-%21%21%21-PLEASE-READ-BEFORE-POSTING-%21%21%21-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-%21%21%21-PLEASE-READ-BEFORE-POSTING-%21%21%21-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide)

Also, welcome to the forums! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Cheers,

~Claw

Thanks! I'm using version 1.0.4.861 the only thing I did to the save file was bring jeb back to life after an \*cough\* unfortunate accident

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/4macslp9gfvzyzd/output_log.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/4macslp9gfvzyzd/output_log.txt?dl=0)

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/z3a544kv0hidlg7/persistent.sfs?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/z3a544kv0hidlg7/persistent.sfs?dl=0)

Looks like your save is corrupted by a stray kerbal. The kerbal looks like it was part of a rescue at some point, but now the information is orphaned in your save.

Open up your save file with a plain text editor, such as notepad. Then look for the section below and delete it all. Make sure you don't leave any stray blank lines in between the information around this Vessel structure (KSP doesn't like that).

It's probably easiest to find by searching for "Lagerigh" (the name of the kerbal).

    		VESSEL		{			pid = 6cea22dd0f0a4320831ffc0b99d9fddb			name = Lagerigh Kerman			type = EVA			sit = LANDED			landed = True			landedAt = 			splashed = False			met = 2929699.37318032			lct = 2929699.37318032			root = 0			lat = -46.6888484719376			lon = -105.679574779086			alt = 2905.2595262384			hgt = 0			nrm = 0,1,0			rot = 0.3957458,0.04664666,-0.02013212,0.9169537			CoM = 0,0,0			stg = 0			prst = True			ref = 0			ctrl = False			ORBIT			{				SMA = NaN				ECC = 1				INC = NaN				LPE = 0.761612657810946				LAN = 129.371554957931				MNA = -8.40714670366795				EPH = 3190749.34396434				REF = 2			}			PART			{				name = kerbalEVA				cid = 0				uid = 528772138				mid = 528772138				launchID = 0				parent = 0				position = 0,0,0				rotation = 0,0,0,1				mirror = 1,1,1				symMethod = Radial				istg = 0				dstg = 0				sqor = 0				sepI = 0				sidx = 0				attm = 0				srfN = None, -1				mass = 3.125				temp = 0				tempExt = 0				expt = 0				state = 0				connected = True				attached = True				flag = Squad/Agencies/MovingPartsExpertsGroup				rTrf = 				modCost = 0			}			ACTIONGROUPS			{			}			DISCOVERY			{				state = 21				lastObservedTime = 3163350.81598186				lifetime = 163919128.32893				refTime = 163919128.32893				size = 0			}			FLIGHTPLAN			{			}			CTRLSTATE			{			}		}

Cheers,

~Claw
It worked! Thank you so much! I guess i should be more careful next time I accept a rescue mission.
